title: MY CLIENT IS BROKEN????
body:
Dear riot,

my client keep giving me error everytime that i join a party or i create one. 
Now everytime that im in game my ms goes up to 1200, while it's usually 76 ms constant, and also i can't answer or write messages in game even if the summoner's name is correct
I already did the repair twice and it didn't change anything. Can someone help me pls? 
Thanks

replies.body:
Hey there,

[The error is currently a known issue and a fix should be released soon](http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support-oce/AnHEmOh7-club-tag-creation-disabled-and-server-error-message-in-client), this is unrelated to your connection issues.

Could you do the following for me;

* [Download WinMTR](https://sourceforge.net/projects/winmtr/files/WinMTR-v092.zip/download) and run a traceroute to the following IP. (Allow this to run for 5-15 minutes)
  * 103.240.227.5
* Once adequate time has passed, stop the traceroute, export your results as text.
* Run the [ICSI netalyzr](http://netalyzr.icsi.berkeley.edu/).
* Post back with a link to your WinMTR results (You can use [pastebin](http://pastebin.com/) for this) and a link to your ICSI netalyzr results.
There is a problem, because i play on a mac, so with os x and not windows, so winmtr doesn't work

To run an MTR on mac, please perform the following steps.

* Go [here](http://rudix.org/packages/mtr.html) and download the package appropriate for your version of OSX
* Install it
* [Open terminal](http://i.imgur.com/10nFokA.png)
* Run the following command and hit enter (Allow this to run for 5-15 minutes)

>sudo /usr/local/sbin/mtr 103.240.227.5

* After a reasonable amount of time has elapsed (5-15 minutes) please screenshot your results (follow steps below)
 * Hit cmd+shft+4, then hit space
 *  click on the Terminal window (your mouse cursor should turn into a camera icon and the window should be highlighted on mouse over)
* Upload the screenshot anywhere you would like and link here ([Imgur](http://imgur.com/), etc)

That's odd, did you install the package correctly?

Could you try running this instead

>sudo /usr/local/bin/mtr 103.240.227.5
